title: Conservation of energy - sliding down a ramp

content.prompt: A block slides down a rough ramp starting from rest at a height of 20â€‰m and reaches a final speed of 16m/s at the bottom of the ramp. Which of the following systems of objects experiences a decrease in energy and what reasoning justifies this answer?

choices.label: The block-ramp system, because the surface of the ramp does negative work on the block which reduces the total energy of the system.
The block-ramp system, because the Earth does negative work on the block which reduces the total energy of the system.
The block-Earth system. The component of the force exerted by the ramp's surface on the block parallel to the ramp dissipates energy, reducing the mechanical energy of the system.
The block-Earth system. The component of the force exerted by the ramp's surface on the block perpendicular to the ramp dissipates energy, reducing the mechanical energy of the system.

skill.text: 3.C: Justify or support a claim using evidence from experimental data, physical representations, or physical principles or laws.
